titleStmt.title: Bridge Phase 2: Witness fMS, Collation unit C25

availability.licence: Distributed under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported License

body.ab:
<lb n="c57-0092__main__1"/><milestone spanTo="#c57-0092.02" unit="tei:head"/>Chap <del loc="c57-0092__main__d1e14539__Start"/>11<del loc="c57-0092__main__d1e14539__End"/> 2.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0092__main__2"/>London
was
<del loc="c57-0092__main__d1e14548__Start"/>the<del loc="c57-0092__main__d1e14548__End"/>
our present point <lb n="c57-0092__main__3"/>of rest; we determined to remain several <lb n="c57-0092__main__4"/>months in this wonderful & celebrated city.
<lb n="c57-0092__main__5"/>Cl<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>erval <del loc="c57-0092__main__d1e14569__Start"/>wished<del loc="c57-0092__main__d1e14569__End"/>desired for
the intercourse of <lb n="c57-0092__main__6"/>the men of genius & talent who flou<lb n="c57-0092__main__7"/>rished at
that
time; but this
was,
with
<lb n="c57-0092__main__8"/>me,
a secondary
<del loc="c57-0092__main__d1e14589__Start"/>consideration<del loc="c57-0092__main__d1e14589__End"/>object;
I was princi<lb n="c57-0092__main__9"/>pally occupied with the means of obtaining <lb n="c57-0092__main__10"/>the information necessary for the comple<lb n="c57-0092__main__11"/>tion of my
promise
and quickly availed <lb n="c57-0092__main__12"/>myself of the letters of introduction that <lb n="c57-0092__main__13"/>I had brought with
me
addressed to <lb n="c57-0092__main__14"/>the
<del loc="c57-0092__main__d1e14620__Start"/>various<del loc="c57-0092__main__d1e14620__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>most<del loc="c57-0092__main__d1e14630__Start"/>men of sci<del loc="c57-0092__main__d1e14630__End"/>
distinguished <lb n="c57-0092__main__15"/>natural
philosophers. If
this journey had <lb n="c57-0092__main__16"/>taken place during my days of study
&<lb n="c57-0092__main__17"/>happiness
it would have afforded me <lb n="c57-0092__main__18"/>inexpressible
<del loc="c57-0092__main__d1e14643__Start"/>delight<del loc="c57-0092__main__d1e14643__End"/>
pleasure. But a <lb n="c57-0092__main__19"/>blight had come over my
existence
& I only <lb n="c57-0092__main__20"/>visited these people for the sake of the <lb n="c57-0092__main__21"/>information they might
give<del loc="c57-0092__main__d1e14653__Start"/>d<del loc="c57-0092__main__d1e14653__End"/>
me on <lb n="c57-0092__main__22"/>the subject in which
I
was so
deeply <lb n="c57-0092__main__23"/>interrested.
Company was irksome to me; <lb n="c57-0092__main__24"/>when
alone
I could fill my mind with the <lb n="c57-0092__main__25"/>sights of heaven & earth; the voice of
<del loc="c57-0092__main__d1e14671__Start"/>He<del loc="c57-0092__main__d1e14671__End"/><lb n="c57-0092__main__26"/><lb n="c57-0092__left_margin__1"/>Henry
soothed
me
& I could
cheat myself into
a<lb n="c57-0092__main__27"/>transitory
peace. But
busy, uninterresting,<lb n="c57-0092__main__28"/>joyous
faces brought back despair to
my<lb n="c57-0092__main__29"/>heart.
I saw an insurmountable
barrie<lb n="c57-0092__main__30"/>placed
between me & my
fellow men;
thi<lb n="c57-0092__main__31"/>barrier
was sealed with the blood
of<lb n="c57-0092__main__32"/>William
and
Justine,
and to reflect
on<lb n="c57-0092__main__33"/>those
events
filled my soul with
anguish<lb n="c57-0092__main__34"/>But
in Clerval I saw the image of my <lb n="c57-0092__main__35"/>former self; he was
inquisitive
&
anxious<lb n="c57-0093__main__1"/>to
gain experience &
instruction;
The <lb n="c57-0093__main__2"/>difference of manners
<del loc="c57-0093__main__d1e14737__Start"/>that<del loc="c57-0093__main__d1e14737__End"/>which
he observed <lb n="c57-0093__main__3"/>was to him
<del loc="c57-0093__main__d1e14746__Start"/>&<del loc="c57-0093__main__d1e14746__End"/>
an inexhaustible source
of
<lb n="c57-0093__main__4"/><lb n="c57-0093__left_margin__1"/>observation &amusement.
He was for ever
busy
& the <lb n="c57-0093__main__5"/>only check to his enjoyments was my
sor<lb n="c57-0093__main__6"/>rowful&
dejected
mien.
I tried to conceal <lb n="c57-0093__main__7"/>this as much as
possible
that I might not <lb n="c57-0093__main__8"/>debar him from the pleasures natural <lb n="c57-0093__main__9"/>to
one
who was entering on a new scene <lb n="c57-0093__main__10"/>of life, undisturbed by any care or
<del loc="c57-0093__main__d1e14781__Start"/>the<del loc="c57-0093__main__d1e14781__End"/>bitter<lb n="c57-0093__main__11"/><lb n="c57-0093__left_margin__1"/><del loc="c57-0093__left_margin__d1e14793__Start"/>ness of
<del loc="c57-0093__left_margin__d1e14793__End"/>recollection. I often refused to accompany
<lb n="c57-0093__main__12"/>him alledging
another
engagement
that <lb n="c57-0093__main__13"/>I might remain
a alone;
I now also <lb n="c57-0093__main__14"/>began to collect the materials necessary <lb n="c57-0093__main__15"/>for my
<del loc="c57-0093__main__d1e14808__Start"/>work<del loc="c57-0093__main__d1e14808__End"/>
new
creation
& this was
<del loc="c57-0093__main__d1e14811__Start"/>a<del loc="c57-0093__main__d1e14811__End"/>
to <lb n="c57-0093__main__16"/>me like the torture of single drops of <lb n="c57-0093__main__17"/>water continually falling on the
head;
<lb n="c57-0093__main__18"/>Every thought that was devoted to it <lb n="c57-0093__main__19"/>was
<del loc="c57-0093__main__d1e14823__Start"/>th<del loc="c57-0093__main__d1e14823__End"/>
an extreme anguish, and every <lb n="c57-0093__main__20"/>word that I spoke in allusion to it caused <lb n="c57-0093__main__21"/>my lips to
quiver
& my heart to
palpitate.<lb n="c57-0093__main__22"/><del loc="c57-0093__main__d1e14835__Start"/>in a most painful degre<del loc="c57-0093__main__d1e14835__End"/><del loc="c57-0093__main__d1e14837__Start"/>e.<del loc="c57-0093__main__d1e14837__End"/><milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0093__main__23"/>After
passing some months in
<lb n="c57-0093__main__24"/>London
we received a letter from a <lb n="c57-0093__main__25"/>person in
Scotland
who had formerly <lb n="c57-0093__main__26"/>been
<del loc="c57-0093__main__d1e14850__Start"/>an<del loc="c57-0093__main__d1e14850__End"/>
our
visitor
at Geneva. He <lb n="c57-0093__main__27"/>mentioned the beauties of his native
coun<lb n="c57-0093__main__28"/>try&
asked us if those were not sufficient <lb n="c57-0093__main__29"/>allurements to induce us to prolong our <lb n="c57-0093__main__30"/>journey as far
<del loc="c57-0093__main__d1e14866__Start"/>noth<del loc="c57-0093__main__d1e14866__End"/>
north as
Perth
<lb n="c57-0093__main__31"/>where he resided.
Cl<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>erval
eagerly desired <lb n="c57-0093__main__32"/>to accept this
invitation,
and I, although <lb n="c57-0093__main__33"/>I abhorred society, wished to view again <lb n="c57-0093__main__34"/>mountains &
streams
& all
the
<del loc="c57-0093__main__d1e14888__Start"/>the<del loc="c57-0093__main__d1e14888__End"/> wondrous <lb n="c57-0093__main__35"/>works
of
nature
in
her chosen
dwelling places<lb n="c57-0094__main__1"/>We
had arrived in
Englan <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>at
the beginning <lb n="c57-0094__main__2"/>of
October
and it was now
february;
we according<lb n="c57-0094__main__3"/>ly determined to commence our journey <lb n="c57-0094__main__4"/>towards the north
at <del loc="c57-0094__main__d1e14921__Start"/>ex<del loc="c57-0094__main__d1e14921__End"/>
at the expiration of <lb n="c57-0094__main__5"/>another month. In this expedition we did <lb n="c57-0094__main__6"/>not intend to follow the great road to
Edinburgh
<lb n="c57-0094__main__7"/>But to visit Windsor, Oxford,
Matlock
& the <lb n="c57-0094__main__8"/>Cumberland
lakes
resolving to arrive at the <lb n="c57-0094__main__9"/>completion of this tour about the end of <lb n="c57-0094__main__10"/>July. I packed
my chemical
instruments
<lb n="c57-0094__main__11"/>& the materials
which
I had
collected
resolv<lb n="c57-0094__main__12"/>ing to finish my labours in some obscure <lb n="c57-0094__main__13"/>nook in the
country.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0094__main__14"/>We
quitted London on the
27
of
<lb n="c57-0094__main__15"/>March
and
remain<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>ed
a few days at
Windsor
<lb n="c57-0094__main__16"/>rambling in its beautiful forest. This was <lb n="c57-0094__main__17"/>a new scene to us mountaineers; The
<del loc="c57-0094__main__d1e14969__Start"/>beauti<del loc="c57-0094__main__d1e14969__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>majectic<lb n="c57-0094__main__18"/><del loc="c57-0094__main__d1e14978__Start"/>ful<del loc="c57-0094__main__d1e14978__End"/> oaks
the quantity of
game
& the
beau<lb n="c57-0094__main__19"/>tiful flocks
of
<del loc="c57-0094__main__d1e14996__Start"/>beautiful<del loc="c57-0094__main__d1e14996__End"/>lovely deer
were all novelties <lb n="c57-0094__main__20"/>to
us. From
thence we proceeded to Oxford.
<lb n="c57-0094__main__21"/>We
were
charmed
with the
appearance
<lb n="c57-0094__main__22"/>of the
town. The colledges are antient and <lb n="c57-0094__main__23"/>picturesque, the streets broard
&
the lands<lb n="c57-0094__main__24"/>cape rendered perfect by the lovely Isis.<lb n="c57-0094__main__25"/>which <del loc="c57-0094__main__d1e15024__Start"/>near
here<del loc="c57-0094__main__d1e15024__End"/>
spreads into broard &<lb n="c57-0094__main__26"/>placid expance of water & runs south <lb n="c57-0094__main__27"/>of the town. We
had
<del loc="c57-0094__main__d1e15032__Start"/>seve<del loc="c57-0094__main__d1e15032__End"/> letters
to
several <lb n="c57-0094__main__28"/>of
the
professors <del loc="c57-0094__main__d1e15042__Start"/>& were<del loc="c57-0094__main__d1e15042__End"/>who received <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>us with great <lb n="c57-0094__main__29"/>politeness &<del loc="c57-0094__main__d1e15062__Start"/>cord<del loc="c57-0094__main__d1e15062__End"/> cordiality. We found that
the
<lb n="c57-0094__main__30"/>regulations
of
this university were much <lb n="c57-0094__main__31"/>improved since
the
days of Gibbon; But <lb n="c57-0094__main__32"/>there is still <del loc="c57-0094__main__d1e15071__Start"/>pr<del loc="c57-0094__main__d1e15071__End"/> in fashion
a
great deal
<lb n="c57-0094__main__33"/>of
bigotry & devotion to established rules that <lb n="c57-0094__main__34"/>constrains
the
mind
of
the students & leads <lb n="c57-0094__main__35"/>to slavish
&
narrow principles of action.<lb n="c57-0095__main__1"/>Many enormities are also practised which <lb n="c57-0095__main__2"/>although they might excite
the
laughter
<lb n="c57-0095__main__3"/>of
a stranger were looked upon
in
the <lb n="c57-0095__main__4"/><lb n="c57-0095__left_margin__1"/>world of
the
university as matters of
the
utmost <lb n="c57-0095__main__5"/>consequence. Some of
the
gentlemen obsti<lb n="c57-0095__main__6"/>nately wore light coloured pantaloons <lb n="c57-0095__main__7"/>when
it
was the rule
of
the colledge to <lb n="c57-0095__main__8"/>wear dark: the masters were angry <lb n="c57-0095__main__9"/>& their sc<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>holar<del loc="c57-0095__main__d1e15133__Start"/>d<del loc="c57-0095__main__d1e15133__End"/>s resolute so that while <lb n="c57-0095__main__10"/>we were there<lb n="c57-0095__left_margin__1"/>during our stay two of the students were <lb n="c57-0095__main__11"/>on the point of being expelled on this<lb n="c57-0095__main__12"/>very question. The threatened severity <lb n="c57-0095__main__13"/>caused a considerable change in
the
<lb n="c57-0095__main__14"/>costume
of the
gentlemen
for
seve<lb n="c57-0095__main__15"/>ral days.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0095__main__16"/>Such, to our infinite astonishment, <lb n="c57-0095__main__17"/>we found to be the principal topic <lb n="c57-0095__main__18"/>of conversation when we arrived in
<lb n="c57-0095__main__19"/>the
town. Our minds had been filled <lb n="c57-0095__main__20"/>with
the
remembrance
of
<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>the events that <lb n="c57-0095__main__21"/>had been transacted here above <lb n="c57-0095__main__22"/><lb n="c57-0095__left_margin__1"/><del loc="c57-0095__left_margin__d1e15208__Start"/>two <del loc="c57-0095__left_margin__d1e15208__End"/><del loc="c57-0095__main__d1e15211__Start"/>a<del loc="c57-0095__main__d1e15211__End"/> centurys& a half before. It was here that Charles
<lb n="c57-0095__main__23"/>I
had collected his forces; this town had <lb n="c57-0095__main__24"/>been faithful to him when the whole <lb n="c57-0095__main__25"/>nation had forsaken him
to
join the <lb n="c57-0095__main__26"/>standard of parliament & liberty. <lb n="c57-0095__main__27"/>It was strange
to
us <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>as we enter<del loc="c57-0095__main__d1e15252__Start"/>ing<del loc="c57-0095__main__d1e15252__End"/>ed in the town <lb n="c57-0095__main__28"/><del loc="c57-0095__main__d1e15260__Start"/>full of the<del loc="c57-0095__main__d1e15260__End"/> our thoughts were occupied <lb n="c57-0095__main__29"/>by the memory the unfortunate king, <lb n="c57-0095__main__30"/>the amiable Falkland
and
the insolent <lb n="c57-0095__main__31"/>Gower <del loc="c57-0095__main__d1e15284__Start"/>and finding<del loc="c57-0095__main__d1e15284__End"/>but we found it filled with <lb n="c57-0095__main__32"/><del loc="c57-0095__main__d1e15292__Start"/>gown<del loc="c57-0095__main__d1e15292__End"/> gownsmen & students who think
<lb n="c57-0095__main__33"/>of
nothing less than these events. Yet <lb n="c57-0095__main__34"/>there are some relics to remind you <lb n="c57-0095__main__35"/>of antient times; Among others
we
regarded<lb n="c57-0096__main__1"/>with curiosity
the
press instituted by
the
author <lb n="c57-0096__main__2"/>of
the
history <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>of the troubles We <del loc="c57-0096__main__d1e15321__Start"/>we<del loc="c57-0096__main__d1e15321__End"/>re also shewn
a
room<lb n="c57-0096__main__3"/>which <del loc="c57-0096__main__d1e15335__Start"/>the<del loc="c57-0096__main__d1e15335__End"/><del loc="c57-0096__main__d1e15338__Start"/>Lord Chancellor<del loc="c57-0096__main__d1e15338__End"/>Frier Bacon <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>the disoverer of gunpowder had <lb n="c57-0096__main__4"/>inhabited and which, as it was predicted, <lb n="c57-0096__main__5"/>would fall in when a man wiser than <lb n="c57-0096__main__6"/>that philosopher should enter it. <note> no sweet Pecksie–'twas friar Bacon the discoverer of gunpowder. </note> A <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>a short, round faced pratingprofes<lb n="c57-0096__main__7"/>sor who accompanied us<del loc="c57-0096__main__d1e15384__Start"/>e<del loc="c57-0096__main__d1e15384__End"/> refused to pass
<lb n="c57-0096__main__8"/>the
threshold; although we ventured inside <lb n="c57-0096__main__9"/>in perfect <del loc="c57-0096__main__d1e15392__Start"/>safety<del loc="c57-0096__main__d1e15392__End"/>. security
<lb n="c57-0096__left_margin__1"/>and
probably <lb n="c57-0096__left_margin__2"/>he might <lb n="c57-0096__left_margin__3"/>have done the same<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0096__main__10"/>Matlock,
which was our next <lb n="c57-0096__main__11"/>place
of
rest, resembled
to a great<del loc="c57-0096__main__d1e15413__Start"/>er<del loc="c57-0096__main__d1e15413__End"/>
degree
<lb n="c57-0096__main__12"/>the scenery of Switzerland; But every thing <lb n="c57-0096__main__13"/>is on a lower
scale
& the green
<del loc="c57-0096__main__d1e15422__Start"/>mountains<del loc="c57-0096__main__d1e15422__End"/>hills<lb n="c57-0096__main__14"/>want
the
<del loc="c57-0096__main__d1e15434__Start"/>cwon<del loc="c57-0096__main__d1e15434__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>crown
of distant white
alps
<lb n="c57-0096__main__15"/>which always attend on the piny
<del loc="c57-0096__main__d1e15447__Start"/>hills<del loc="c57-0096__main__d1e15447__End"/><lb n="c57-0096__main__16"/><del loc="c57-0096__main__d1e15453__Start"/>mountains<del loc="c57-0096__main__d1e15453__End"/>
of
our
country. We visited <lb n="c57-0096__main__17"/>the wondrous
cave
&
the
<del loc="c57-0096__main__d1e15460__Start"/>the<del loc="c57-0096__main__d1e15460__End"/> little cabinets <lb n="c57-0096__main__18"/>of natural
history
where the curiosities <lb n="c57-0096__main__19"/>are disposed in the same manner <lb n="c57-0096__main__20"/>as in the collections at Servox
&Chamou<lb n="c57-0096__main__21"/>nix.
The latter
mame
made me
tremble
<lb n="c57-0096__main__22"/>when pronounced by
Henry
& I hastened <lb n="c57-0096__main__23"/>to quit
Matlock where the scenes were
<lb n="c57-0096__main__24"/>thus
ascociated.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0096__main__25"/>From
Derby,
still journeying north<lb n="c57-0096__main__26"/>ward, we passed two months
among the <lb n="c57-0096__main__27"/>mountains of<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>in
Cumberland &
Westmorland.
<lb n="c57-0096__main__28"/>I could now almost fancy myself among <lb n="c57-0096__main__29"/>the Swiss
mountains;
The little patches of <lb n="c57-0096__main__30"/>snow which yet lingered on the
northern<lb n="c57-0096__main__31"/>sides
of the
mountains –
the
lakes
& the <lb n="c57-0096__main__32"/>dashing of the rocky
<del loc="c57-0096__main__d1e15535__Start"/>mountain<del loc="c57-0096__main__d1e15535__End"/> streams
<lb n="c57-0096__main__33"/>were all
<del loc="c57-0096__main__d1e15541__Start"/>dear<del loc="c57-0096__main__d1e15541__End"/>
familiar & dear sights <lb n="c57-0096__main__34"/>to me. Here also we made some
aquain<lb n="c57-0097__main__1"/>tances
who almost contrived to cheat <lb n="c57-0097__main__2"/>me into happiness. The delight of
<lb n="c57-0097__main__3"/>Cl<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>erval
was proportionably greater <lb n="c57-0097__main__4"/>than mine; his mind expanded in <lb n="c57-0097__main__5"/>the company of men of
talent
& he found <lb n="c57-0097__main__6"/>in
himself
greater
capacity
&
feeling
<lb n="c57-0097__main__7"/>than he could
^have
imagined himself to <lb n="c57-0097__main__8"/>have possessed while he associated <lb n="c57-0097__main__9"/>with his inferiors.
"I
could pass my life
<lb n="c57-0097__main__10"/>here,"
said he to
me, "and
among these <lb n="c57-0097__main__11"/>mountains I should
hardly
regret <lb n="c57-0097__main__12"/>Switzerland & the
Rhine.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0097__main__13"/>But
he found that a
travellers
<lb n="c57-0097__main__14"/>life is
<del loc="c57-0097__main__d1e15610__Start"/>that<del loc="c57-0097__main__d1e15610__End"/>
one that includes much <lb n="c57-0097__main__15"/>pain amidst its enjoyments. His feelings
<lb n="c57-0097__main__16"/><del loc="c57-0097__main__d1e15618__Start"/>were<del loc="c57-0097__main__d1e15618__End"/>are
for ever on the
strectch
& when <lb n="c57-0097__main__17"/>he begins to sink into
repose
he
<lb n="c57-0097__main__18"/>f<del loc="c57-0097__main__d1e15641__Start"/>ound<del loc="c57-0097__main__d1e15641__End"/>inds
himself obliged
<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>to
quit
it
for something
<lb n="c57-0097__main__19"/>new
which again engages his
atten<lb n="c57-0097__main__20"/>tion&
which
<del loc="c57-0097__main__d1e15673__Start"/>he<del loc="c57-0097__main__d1e15673__End"/>
also he
fors<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>akes
for
<lb n="c57-0097__main__21"/><del loc="c57-0097__main__d1e15693__Start"/>more<del loc="c57-0097__main__d1e15693__End"/><lb n="c57-0097__left_margin__1"/>other novelties. We
had scarcely visited <lb n="c57-0097__main__22"/>the various lakes of Cumberland
&<lb n="c57-0097__main__23"/>Westmorland
& conceived an affection <lb n="c57-0097__main__24"/>for some of the
inhabitants
when the <lb n="c57-0097__main__25"/>period of our appointment with our <lb n="c57-0097__main__26"/>Scotch friend
approached
& we left
them<lb n="c57-0097__main__27"/>to
travel on. For my own part I was <lb n="c57-0097__main__28"/>not sorry. I had now neglected my promise <lb n="c57-0097__main__29"/>for some
time
and I feared the effects <lb n="c57-0097__main__30"/>of the
dæmons
disappointment. He <lb n="c57-0097__main__31"/>might remain in
Switzerland
&
wreack
<lb n="c57-0097__main__32"/>his vengeance
of
my
relati<del loc="c57-0097__main__d1e15742__Start"/>ons<del loc="c57-0097__main__d1e15742__End"/>ves;
this idea
<lb n="c57-0097__main__33"/>persued me
& tormented me at every <lb n="c57-0097__main__34"/>moment
when
I might otherwise have <lb n="c57-0097__main__35"/>snatched repose & peace. I waited
for<lb n="c57-0098__main__1"/>my
letters with feverish
impatience;
If they <lb n="c57-0098__main__2"/>were
delayed
I was
miserable
& overcome <lb n="c57-0098__main__3"/>by a thousand fears; & when they
arrived
<lb n="c57-0098__main__4"/>and I saw the superscription of Elizabeth <lb n="c57-0098__main__5"/>or my
father
I hardly dared to read
&ascer<lb n="c57-0098__main__6"/>tain
my fate. Sometimes I thought that the <lb n="c57-0098__main__7"/>fiend followed
me
& might
remind me
<lb n="c57-0098__main__8"/>by murdering my
companion; <del loc="c57-0098__main__d1e15790__Start"/>with<del loc="c57-0098__main__d1e15790__End"/>When
these
<lb n="c57-0098__main__9"/>thoughts<metamark function="displacement" xml:id="c57-0098.01">^</metamark><lb n="c57-0098__left_margin__1"/>posessed me
I would not quit Henry for a
<lb n="c57-0098__main__10"/>moment
but followed him as his
shadow
<lb n="c57-0098__main__11"/>to protect him from
<del loc="c57-0098__main__d1e15821__Start"/>his<del loc="c57-0098__main__d1e15821__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>the
fancied rage <lb n="c57-0098__main__12"/>of his destroyer. I felt as if I had commit<lb n="c57-0098__main__13"/>ted some great
crime
the conscious<lb n="c57-0098__main__14"/>ness of which haunted me. I was
guiltless
<lb n="c57-0098__main__15"/>but I had
<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>indeed
drawn down a horrible curse
<lb n="c57-0098__main__16"/>upon<del loc="c57-0098__main__d1e15869__Start"/>his<del loc="c57-0098__main__d1e15869__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>my head <del loc="c57-0098__main__d1e15880__Start"/>which I in vain endeavoured<del loc="c57-0098__main__d1e15880__End"/>as
mortal as that of
crime<lb n="c57-0098__main__17"/><del loc="c57-0098__main__d1e15886__Start"/>to shake off<del loc="c57-0098__main__d1e15886__End"/>.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0098__main__18"/>I
visited Edinburgh with languid <lb n="c57-0098__main__19"/>eyes &
mind
& yet that city might have
<lb n="c57-0098__main__20"/>interrested
the most unfortunate being. <lb n="c57-0098__main__21"/>Clerval did not like it so well as
<lb n="c57-0098__main__22"/>Oxford
for the antiquity of
thelatter
city was
<lb n="c57-0098__main__23"/>pleasing to him. But the beauty
&regu<lb n="c57-0098__main__24"/>larity
of the new town
<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>of Edinburgh delighted him; its <lb n="c57-0098__main__25"/>environs are also
the most
beautiful
<lb n="c57-0098__main__26"/>in the
world; Arthur's
seat,
St Bernards <lb n="c57-0098__main__27"/>Well
& the Pentland
hills–
But I was im<lb n="c57-0098__main__28"/>patient to arrive at the termination <lb n="c57-0098__main__29"/>of my
journey. <del loc="c57-0098__main__d1e15953__Start"/>and<del loc="c57-0098__main__d1e15953__End"/> We
left Edinburgh in <lb n="c57-0098__main__30"/>a
week
passing through
Cooper, St Andrews
<lb n="c57-0098__main__31"/>& Along
the
the banks of the
Tay
to
Perth
<lb n="c57-0098__main__32"/>Where our friend expected
us;
But I was
<lb n="c57-0098__main__33"/>not
in
the
mood to laugh & talk with
<lb n="c57-0098__main__34"/>Strangers
or enter into their feelings or
plans<lb n="c57-0099__main__1"/>with <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>the
good humour expected from a
<lb n="c57-0099__main__2"/>guest
and accordingly I told Clerval <lb n="c57-0099__main__3"/>that I wished to make the tour of <lb n="c57-0099__main__4"/>Scotland
<del loc="c57-0099__main__d1e16002__Start"/>by myself<del loc="c57-0099__main__d1e16002__End"/>alone. Do you,
said I,
enjoy <lb n="c57-0099__main__5"/>yourself
and let this be our
rendezvous–
<lb n="c57-0099__main__6"/>I may be absent a month or
two,
but do <lb n="c57-0099__main__7"/>not interfere with my
motions
I entreat
<lb n="c57-0099__main__8"/>you;
leave
<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>me
to peace & solitude for <lb n="c57-0099__main__9"/>a short
time
& when I
return
I <lb n="c57-0099__main__10"/>hope it will be with a lighter
heart <lb n="c57-0099__main__11"/><del loc="c57-0099__main__d1e16033__Start"/>fitter for your friend &<del loc="c57-0099__main__d1e16033__End"/>
more congenial <lb n="c57-0099__main__12"/>to your own
temper." Henry
wished <lb n="c57-0099__main__13"/>to dissuade
me but
seeing me bent <lb n="c57-0099__main__14"/>on this
plan <del loc="c57-0099__main__d1e16045__Start"/>consented.<del loc="c57-0099__main__d1e16045__End"/>ceased
to
remonstrate.<del loc="c57-0099__main__d1e16054__Start"/>but<del loc="c57-0099__main__d1e16054__End"/>he
entreated <lb n="c57-0099__main__15"/>me to write often.
I
had rather be <lb n="c57-0099__main__16"/>with
you,
he said,
In
your solitary
<lb n="c57-0099__main__17"/>rambles
than with these scotch
people
<lb n="c57-0099__main__18"/>whom I do not
know;
hasten
then<lb n="c57-0099__main__19"/>my
dear
friend
to
return
that I may <lb n="c57-0099__main__20"/>again feel myself
<del loc="c57-0099__main__d1e16080__Start"/>at<del loc="c57-0099__main__d1e16080__End"/>
somewhat at
<lb n="c57-0099__main__21"/>home
which I cannot do in your
<lb n="c57-0099__main__22"/>absence.<lb n="c57-0100__main__1"/><milestone spanTo="#c57-0100.03" unit="tei:head"/>Chap 12<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0100__main__2"/>Having
parted from my
friend
I
deter <lb n="c57-0100__main__3"/>mined
to visit some remote spot of
<del loc="c57-0100__main__d1e16104__Start"/>this<del loc="c57-0100__main__d1e16104__End"/><lb n="c57-0100__main__4"/>Scotland
and finish my work in solitude. <lb n="c57-0100__main__5"/>I did not doubt but that the monster <lb n="c57-0100__main__6"/>followed me, and would
<del loc="c57-0100__main__d1e16113__Start"/>be<del loc="c57-0100__main__d1e16113__End"/>
discover himself <lb n="c57-0100__main__7"/><lb n="c57-0100__left_margin__1"/>to
me,
when I should have finished, that he might receive his
<lb n="c57-0100__main__8"/>companion. With
this resolution I traversed <lb n="c57-0100__main__9"/>the northern
highlands
and fixed on one of the
<lb n="c57-0100__main__10"/>Orkney Islands for
the scene
of my
labours.
<lb n="c57-0100__main__11"/><del loc="c57-0100__main__d1e16142__Start"/>I was<del loc="c57-0100__main__d1e16142__End"/>
It was a place fitted for such
<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>a work;
<lb n="c57-0100__main__12"/>being hardly more than a
rock
whose high <lb n="c57-0100__main__13"/>sides were continually beaten upon by the
<lb n="c57-0100__main__14"/>waves–
The soil was
barren hardly
affording <lb n="c57-0100__main__15"/>pasture for a few miserable
cows
&
oat <lb n="c57-0100__main__16"/>meal
for its
<del loc="c57-0100__main__d1e16166__Start"/>few<del loc="c57-0100__main__d1e16166__End"/> inhabitants
which consis<lb n="c57-0100__main__17"/>ted of five persons, Whose gaunt & scraggy <lb n="c57-0100__main__18"/>limbs gave tokens of their
sorry
fare.
Fresh <lb n="c57-0100__main__19"/>water.
Vegetables & bread, when they indulged <lb n="c57-0100__main__20"/>in such luxuries, & even fresh
water
was <lb n="c57-0100__main__21"/>to be procured from the main
land
which <lb n="c57-0100__main__22"/>was about five miles
distant. On
the <lb n="c57-0100__main__23"/>whole island there were but three mise<lb n="c57-0100__main__24"/>rable
huts
& one of these was vacant <lb n="c57-0100__main__25"/>when I arrived. This I
hired–
It contained <lb n="c57-0100__main__26"/>but two
rooms &<del loc="c57-0100__main__d1e16210__Start"/>for<del loc="c57-0100__main__d1e16210__End"/>
these exhibited all <lb n="c57-0100__main__27"/>the squalidness of the most miserable
<lb n="c57-0100__main__28"/>p<del loc="c57-0100__main__d1e16220__Start"/>overty<del loc="c57-0100__main__d1e16220__End"/>enury—
The thatch had fallen
in –
the <lb n="c57-0100__main__29"/>walls were
unplastered
& the door was off its <lb n="c57-0100__main__30"/>hinges. I ordered it to be repaired,
<del loc="c57-0100__main__d1e16235__Start"/>&<del loc="c57-0100__main__d1e16235__End"/>
bought <lb n="c57-0100__main__31"/>some
furniture
& took
possession –
an <lb n="c57-0100__main__32"/>incident which
would
have
<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>doubtless
occasioned <lb n="c57-0100__main__33"/>some
surprise
had not all the
<del loc="c57-0100__main__d1e16255__Start"/>th<del loc="c57-0100__main__d1e16255__End"/>
senses <lb n="c57-0100__main__34"/>of the cottagers been benumbed by
want<lb n="c57-0101__main__1"/><lb n="c57-0101__left_margin__1"/>and
squalid
<lb n="c57-0101__left_margin__2"/>poverty;
as it
was
I
<del loc="c57-0101__main__d1e16276__Start"/>arrived<del loc="c57-0101__main__d1e16276__End"/>
lived ungazed at <lb n="c57-0101__main__2"/>and unmolested, hardly thanked for the <lb n="c57-0101__main__3"/>pittance of food and clothes which I
gave
<lb n="c57-0101__main__4"/>so much does suffering blunt even <lb n="c57-0101__main__5"/>the coarsest sensations of
men.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0101__main__6"/><del loc="c57-0101__main__d1e16291__Start"/>I now applied myself to my creation<del loc="c57-0101__main__d1e16291__End"/><milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0101__main__7"/>In
this retreat I devoted the mor<lb n="c57-0101__main__8"/>ning to
labour,
but in the evening, <lb n="c57-0101__main__9"/>when the weather
permitted
I walked <lb n="c57-0101__main__10"/>on the stony beach of the
sea
to listen <lb n="c57-0101__main__11"/>to the waves as they
roared
& dashed at <lb n="c57-0101__main__12"/>my
feet;
It was a
monotonous
yet
<lb n="c57-0101__main__13"/>ever changing
scene. I thought of Swit<lb n="c57-0101__main__14"/>zerland; It was far different from <lb n="c57-0101__main__15"/>this desolate & appalling
<del loc="c57-0101__main__d1e16326__Start"/>scene<del loc="c57-0101__main__d1e16326__End"/>landscape –Its
<lb n="c57-0101__main__16"/>hills are covered with
vines
& its <lb n="c57-0101__main__17"/>cottages are scattered thickly in the
<lb n="c57-0101__main__18"/>plains—
Its fair lakes reflect a <lb n="c57-0101__main__19"/>blue & gentle
sky &
when troubled <lb n="c57-0101__main__20"/>by the
winds it
is but
the play of <lb n="c57-0101__main__21"/>a lively
infant
when compared <lb n="c57-0101__main__22"/>to the roarings of the giant
ocean.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0101__main__23"/>Inthis <del loc="c57-0101__main__d1e16367__Start"/>was at first<del loc="c57-0101__main__d1e16367__End"/>
manner I <lb n="c57-0101__main__24"/>distributed my occupations when I first <lb n="c57-0101__main__25"/>arrived;
but
as I proceeded in my
work
it <lb n="c57-0101__main__26"/>became every day more horrible & irksome <lb n="c57-0101__main__27"/>to me. Sometimes I could
<del loc="c57-0101__main__d1e16382__Start"/><del loc="c57-0101__main__d1e16382__End"/>
not prevail <lb n="c57-0101__main__28"/>on myself to enter my
<del loc="c57-0101__main__d1e16389__Start"/>workshop<del loc="c57-0101__main__d1e16389__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>laboratory
for several
<lb n="c57-0101__main__29"/>days
and at other times I
<del loc="c57-0101__main__d1e16404__Start"/>laboured<del loc="c57-0101__main__d1e16404__End"/>toiled
day
&<lb n="c57-0101__main__30"/>night
in order to
<del loc="c57-0101__main__d1e16416__Start"/>finish<del loc="c57-0101__main__d1e16416__End"/>complete it.
It
was indeed
<lb n="c57-0101__main__31"/>a
<del loc="c57-0101__main__d1e16425__Start"/>filhthy<del loc="c57-0101__main__d1e16425__End"/>
filthy
work
in which I
wasen<lb n="c57-0101__main__32"/>gaged. <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>During
my first
experiment
a kind of <lb n="c57-0101__main__33"/>enthusiastic frenzy
<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>had
blinded me to the <lb n="c57-0101__main__34"/>horror of my employment; my mind was <lb n="c57-0101__main__35"/>intently fixed on the
sequel
of my
labour<lb n="c57-0102__main__1"/>and
my eyes were shut to the horror of my <lb n="c57-0102__main__2"/>proceedings. But now I went to it in cold
<lb n="c57-0102__main__3"/>blood
and my heart often
sicken<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>ed
at the <lb n="c57-0102__main__4"/>work of my hands.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0102__main__5"/>Thus
situated;
employed in the most <lb n="c57-0102__main__6"/>detestable occupation,
in
<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>a
solitude
where<lb n="c57-0102__main__7"/>nothing
could for an instant call my
<del loc="c57-0102__main__d1e16510__Start"/>reflec<del loc="c57-0102__main__d1e16510__End"/>attention<lb n="c57-0102__main__8"/><del loc="c57-0102__main__d1e16516__Start"/>tions<del loc="c57-0102__main__d1e16516__End"/>
from the actual scene in which I <lb n="c57-0102__main__9"/>was engaged, my spirits
<del loc="c57-0102__main__d1e16524__Start"/>became<del loc="c57-0102__main__d1e16524__End"/>were unequal,
I
<lb n="c57-0102__main__10"/>became
restless &
nervous–
Every moment I <lb n="c57-0102__main__11"/>feared to meet
<del loc="c57-0102__main__d1e16536__Start"/>the<del loc="c57-0102__main__d1e16536__End"/>
my persecutor. Sometimes <lb n="c57-0102__main__12"/>I sat with my eyes fixed on the
ground
fear<lb n="c57-0102__main__13"/>ing to raise
them
lest they should
meet <lb n="c57-0102__main__14"/><del loc="c57-0102__main__d1e16551__Start"/>him<del loc="c57-0102__main__d1e16551__End"/>the
object which I so much dreaded to
<del loc="c57-0102__main__d1e16560__Start"/>see<del loc="c57-0102__main__d1e16560__End"/>behold
I feared <lb n="c57-0102__main__15"/><lb n="c57-0102__left_margin__1"/>to wander from the sight of my
fellow crea<lb n="c57-0102__main__16"/>tures
lest when alone
<del loc="c57-0102__main__d1e16582__Start"/>he<del loc="c57-0102__main__d1e16582__End"/>
He should come <lb n="c57-0102__main__17"/>to claim his
companion. <del loc="c57-0102__main__d1e16587__Start"/>In<del loc="c57-0102__main__d1e16587__End"/> In
the <lb n="c57-0102__main__18"/>mean time I worked
on
& my
<del loc="c57-0102__main__d1e16593__Start"/>f<del loc="c57-0102__main__d1e16593__End"/>
labour <lb n="c57-0102__main__19"/>was already considerably
advanced–
I looked
<lb n="c57-0102__main__20"/>with pleasure
towards
<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>its
completion
yet <lb n="c57-0102__main__21"/>freedom from the curse
I
endured
was
<lb n="c57-0102__main__22"/>a joy I never dared promise myself— <lb n="c57-0102__main__23"/> <note> Finish Chap. 2 here </note>
